intro: Strychnos reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined strychnos, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded forest environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
